FeedItems.Title: NuGet Spring 2019 Roadmap
FeedItems.Summary: We published our last NuGet roadmap in June last year. Many of the features announced were major additions to NuGet and we have been hard at work to implement those over the last few months. In this...

FeedItems.Title: Enable repeatable package restores using a lock file
FeedItems.Summary: With PackageReference, NuGet always tries to produce the same closure of package dependencies if the input package reference list has not changed. However, there are a few scenarios where it may not...

FeedItems.Title: Lock down your dependencies using configurable trust policies

FeedItems.Title: Improved package debugging experience with the NuGet.org symbol server

FeedItems.Title: Introducing Source Code Link for NuGet packages
FeedItems.Summary: NuGet.org now supports surfacing source code repository link for NuGet packages. This will enable package authors to surface both the project’s website and the source repository using the...

FeedItems.Title: NuGet.org starts repo-signing packages
FeedItems.Summary: In May, we implemented Stage 1 and enabled support for any NuGet.org user to submit signed packages to NuGet.org. Today, we are announcing Stage 2 of our NuGet package signing journey – tamper...

FeedItems.Title: NuGet Summer 2018 Roadmap
FeedItems.Summary: This blog post provides insights into the NuGet team plans for the upcoming quarter (July – Sep 2018). In the March 2018 NuGet Spring 2018 Roadmap, we had outlined Package Signing,...

FeedItems.Title: Introducing signed package submissions to NuGet.org
FeedItems.Summary: In September 2017, we announced our plans to improve the security of the NuGet ecosystem by introducing the ability for package authors to sign packages. Today, we want to announce support for any...

FeedItems.Title: Welcoming SymbolSource to the .NET Foundation
FeedItems.Summary: We are excited to welcome SymbolSource.org to the .NET Foundation! SymbolSource has been providing a valuable service to the .NET Community for years with the ability to host Symbols for public NuGet...

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Move more services to Library And enable real deletes" (#7338) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Moves more of the implementations of required services into NuGetGallery.Services library.
Updates AccountDeleter to consume these changes.

Merge changes and test fixes coming soon.

Please look at changes by commit to make this more managable. Thanks.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Azure Search] Figure out automatic secret rotation for Azure Search Service" (#7337) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
The Azure Search web app can live indefinitely and secrets are cached for process lifetime.

How do we get new secrets picked up without redeployment?

Opened issue "[GitHub Usage] Make feature public" (#7336) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody: Make sure Anand and Kaitlin are okay with it, then make it public!

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[GitHub Usage] Author the blog post" (#7335) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Author the blog post with Lo√Øc and Anand.
- Tweet
  - Announce it
  - Ask for feedback
- Blog post
  - How the job works
  - Why we made this (what's the customer win?)
  - Ask for feedback
  - How can you run it yourself (link to a Readme.md?)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[GitHub Usage] Find all popular C# GitHub projects" (#7207) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody: Use GitHub search APIs to find popular C# projects. Add this to the job

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[2019.07.10][ReleasePrep] RI dev into master" (#7331) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Opened issue "[Azure Search] Figure out how to properly boost packages that just match on tag" (#7334) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Dapper matches "ORM" tag but is currently not getting a boost from that so it appears very low in results.

Some communities have centered around a specific tag, e.g. `tags:"aws-sdk-v3"`. These cases should work well too.

It may work okay right now with field scoping to tags, but for example "tags:orm" is still not perfect.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Azure Search] Investigate and improve and/or problem in matching" (#7333) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Right now if multiple terms in a search query match, the "boost" doesn't seem very extreme as if it is as relevant as only one term matching.

Azure Search people can help here.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Azure Search] Get rid of freshness in scoring profile until we do more analysis" (#7332) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Closed issue "[Azure Search] Generate aggregated ID tokens searchable field" (#7129) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody: needed to remove delimiters from IDs and to be used for prefix matching

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[2019.07.10][ReleasePrep] RI dev into master" (#7331) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Opened issue "[Azure Search] Weaken exact matches" (#7330) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Describe the bug
Search results are dramatically boosted if one or more terms exactly match the package's id. This leads to weird results for queries like "newtonsoft json" as the "json" package id is an exact match.

Queries that are affected:

* "json" / "newtonsoft json"
* "entity framework"
* "csv"

Opened issue "NU1201	Project Portal.Common is not compatible with netcoreapp2.2 (.NETCoreApp,Version=v2.2). Project Portal.Common supports: net462 (.NETFramework,Version=v4.6.2)	IdentityServer	C:\Users\epari\Work\Doosan\Source\AP\Analytics\IdentityServer\IdentityServer.csproj	1	" (#8318) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Please read the following information before posting the issue.

## Before posting the issue...

* If you're having trouble with the NuGet.org Website, please post in [NuGetGallery issues](http://github.com/nuget/nugetgallery/issues)
* If you're having trouble with the NuGet client tools (the Visual Studio extension, NuGet.exe command line tool, etc.), you are in the right place.

Remove the content above here and fill out details below.

## Details about Problem

NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | VS UI | Package Manager Console | dotnet.exe):

NuGet version (x.x.x.xxx):

dotnet.exe --version (if appropriate):

VS version (if appropriate):

OS version (i.e. win10 v1607 (14393.321)):

Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version:

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1.

2.

...

## Other suggested things

### Verbose Logs

Please include verbose logs (NuGet.exe <COMMAND> -verbosity detailed | dotnet.exe <COMMAND> --verbosity diag | etc...)

### Sample Project

Very helpful if you can zip a project and paste into this issue!

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Investigate whether using ThreadHelper.JoinableTaskFactory or NuGetUIThreadHelper.JoinableTaskFactory is appropriate" (#8317) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
We have lots of inconsistencies in our codebase where we use ThreadHelper.JoinableTaskFactory instead of NuGetUIThreadHelper. 

We need to investigate whether this can cause potential issues and fix them.
